Member Function Documentation

int BHV_FollowLeader::getDesiredPosition (   ) 
 

Computes the desired position (x, y) for the vehicle.

The desired position is a relative range to the target, given by desiredTargetAngle, and angle offset in regards to the target's course, given by desiredTargetAngle.

The desired position is stored in desiredX and desiredY.

Returns:
the quadrant of where the vehicle would be if the target was at origo.
For debug purposes. Quadrants are numbered 1 for a course of [0, 90], 2 (90, 180] and so on. Possible quadrant values are 1 through 4. Retuns 0 if it's not possible to compute the quadrant.
Say for instance that the targetCourse is 45 deg and the desiredTargetAngle is 0. Then the resulting quadrant is 3.

bool BHV_FollowLeader::setParam (  string  param,
string  val
) 
 

Reads parameters from .bhv file.

Is called repeatedly until all parameters are read within the block.

Parameters:
param the current parameter parsed the .bhv file.
val the string value of that parameter.
Returns:
true if the parameter was found and successfully set, false otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

double BHV_FollowLeader::desiredTargetAngle [private]
 

Angle in degrees in the range of [0 360) to keep to target.

The angle is relative the current targets course, which is 0 at magnetic north.

Choosing 0 degrees results in no offset and the vehicle will stay exactly behind the target. Setting the angle to 180 will conversely result in positioning the vehicle strait ahead of the target.
